pageContext.claim: “At the heart of the Iran deal was a giant fiction that a murderous regime desired only a peaceful nuclear energy program. Today, we have definitive proof that this Iranian promise was a lie. Last week, Israel published intelligence documents long concealed by Iran, conclusively showing the Iranian regime and its history of pursuing nuclear weapons.”
pageContext.analysis: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced on April 30 that Israel had obtained a massive cache of documents and data discs from Iran about a clandestine nuclear-weapons development program. Netanyahu said the documents proved that Iran had lied about its past nuclear efforts. Experts and U.S.-allied nations in Europe described Israel’s findings as nothing new and said they strengthened the case for the JCPOA, noting that the documents in question mostly cover the pre-2003 period, during which Iran already was known to have been pursuing nuclear weapons ambitions.
